Class homeController

java.lang.Object
com.FeedEmGreens.HealthyAura.controller.homeController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/home") public class homeController extends Object
Controller that handles homepage content and personalized or general recommendations for users.

This controller powers the landing and recommendation features of the HealthyAura application, providing both personalized and general eatery suggestions based on user login status, location, and selected filters.

Features include:

  • Personalized recommendations for logged-in users
  • General recommendations for visitors
  • Filtering recommendations by tag(s) or postal code

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • home

      @GetMapping("/") public Map<String,String> home()
      Root endpoint for the HealthyAura homepage.

      Returns a simple greeting or banner message for the landing page.

      Returns:
      a map containing a static message for homepage display

    • getRecommendations

      @GetMapping("/recommendations") public List<RecommendationDto> getRecommendations(@RequestParam(required=false) Double lat, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lng)
      Retrieves a list of recommended eateries for the homepage.

      If a user is logged in, this returns personalized recommendations based on the userâ€™s preferences, dietary profile, and location (if provided). Otherwise, it returns general recommendations optionally filtered by latitude and longitude.

      Parameters:
      lat - optional latitude for location-based filtering
      lng - optional longitude for location-based filtering
      Returns:
      a list of RecommendationDto objects representing eatery suggestions

    • getRecommendationsByTag

      @GetMapping("/recommendations/tag/{tag}") public List<RecommendationDto> getRecommendationsByTag(@PathVariable String tag, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lat, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lng)
      Retrieves eatery recommendations filtered by a single tag.

      This endpoint is used for quick filtering on the homepage (e.g., when a user clicks a category button like Vegetarian or High Protein).

      Parameters:
      tag - the tag used for filtering recommendations
      lat - optional latitude for proximity-based filtering
      lng - optional longitude for proximity-based filtering
      Returns:
      a list of RecommendationDto objects filtered by the given tag

    • getRecommendationsByTags

      @GetMapping("/recommendations/tags") public List<RecommendationDto> getRecommendationsByTags(@RequestParam List<String> tags, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lat, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lng)
      Retrieves eatery recommendations filtered by multiple tags.

      Useful for more refined filtering, such as showing eateries that match multiple dietary preferences or categories (e.g., Vegan + Low Carb).

      Parameters:
      tags - a list of tags used for filtering recommendations
      lat - optional latitude for location filtering
      lng - optional longitude for location filtering
      Returns:
      a list of RecommendationDto objects matching all provided tags

    • getRecommendationsByPostalCode

      @GetMapping("/recommendations/postal/{postalCode}") public List<RecommendationDto> getRecommendationsByPostalCode(@PathVariable Long postalCode, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lat, @RequestParam(required=false) Double lng)
      Retrieves recommendations based on a postal code area.

      This endpoint is used for users who prefer searching by location-based identifiers such as postal codes instead of coordinates. The method supports optional latitude and longitude inputs for finer location accuracy.

      Parameters:
      postalCode - the postal code identifying the target area
      lat - optional latitude for refining search
      lng - optional longitude for refining search
      Returns:
      a list of RecommendationDto objects within or near the specified postal area
